headline: Grilled Shrimp Cocktail with Fresh Tomato Cocktail Sauce
description: This grilled shrimp cocktail recipe is paired with a fresh tomato cocktail sauce for a seasonal summer appetizer. The shrimp get lightly charred on the grill, and the cocktail sauce has a smoky kick thanks to smoked sun-dried tomatoes.
name: Grilled Shrimp Cocktail with Fresh Tomato Cocktail Sauce
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds large peeled, deveined raw shrimp, tail-on
1.5 tablespoons grated lemon zest, plus 1 tablespoon fresh juice (from 2 lemons), divided
4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus more for bread slices and drizzling
2 tablespoons grated garlic (from 8 large garlic cloves), divided
2 tablespoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste
0.33 cup julienne-cut smoked sun-dried tomatoes (from 1 [3-ounce] package), chopped (about 1/3 cup)
3 tablespoons mild or spicy harissa paste (from 1 [10-ounce] jar) (such as Mina)
2 cups chopped red tomato (from 1 large [12-ounce] tomato)
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Pat shrimp dry using paper towels; place shrimp in a large bowl. Add crushed red pepper, lemon juice, 3 tablespoons of the oil, 1 tablespoon of the lemon zest, 1 tablespoon of the garlic, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper; toss to coat shrimp evenly. Let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes.

While shrimp marinates, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a small skillet over medium. Add sun-dried tomatoes, harissa paste, and remaining 1 tablespoon garlic. Cook, stirring often, until tomatoes are tender and garlic is soft and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in sherry vinegar. Transfer sun-dried tomato mixture and chopped tomato to food processor bowl. Pulse until mixture is coarsely chopped and uniformly blended but not smooth, 10 to 12 pulses, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl as needed. Stir in hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon of the chopped parsley, and remaining 1/2 tablespoon lemon zest. Season with additional salt to taste; set cocktail sauce aside.

Heat a grill pan over high. Lightly coat grill pan with cooking spray. Brush both sides of sliced bread with additional oil. Grill until toasted and lightly charred on edges, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a platter.

Sprinkle marinated shrimp evenly with remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Add shrimp to grill pan; grill until opaque and lightly charred, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to platter with bread. Spoon cocktail sauce into a bowl, and place alongside shrimp and bread on platter. Sprinkle shrimp, bread, and cocktail sauce evenly with remaining 1 tablespoon parsley; drizzle with additional oil. Serve.
